result.execSummary:
The defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 13CF394 and 14CF53.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

supervisions.notes:
Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Concurrent with: with 13CF394 and 14CF53

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
10:20 a.m. Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Karl Alexander Schmidt. Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in custody. Louis John Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 14CF53 and 14CF54 are Br 1 cases and 15CF98 is Br 2 case. Court will not sentence on 15CF98 as it is a Br 2 case and the sentencing recommendations are not in agreement. DA Molepske states recommendation for sentencing after revocation. Atty Schmidt makes sentencing argument. Defendant makes statements to the Court.

BY THE COURT:

14CF53: 1 yr jail w/huber, concurrent with 13CF394, 127 days credit
Pay balance of costs/surcharges.  
 
14CF54: 1 yr jail w/huber, concurrent with 14CF53 and 13CF394, 127 dayscredit
Pay balance of costs.

Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan today.
(sent copy to SPD/needs atty assigned/kp) - original filed in 14CF53
Sentencing hearing on revocation on December 9, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Ryan W. Drengler. Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in custody. Louis J. Molepske appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are: 13CF-394, 14CF-53, 14CF-54 and 14CF-183.

9:02 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Molepske states appearances.

There is a plea agreement.
13CF-394: Defendant will plead to Count 2 and 3 and 4. Count 1 dismised and read in. imposed/stayed 1 yr jail, 36 mo prob, $500 fine/costs, domestic abuse surcharge, 6 mo jail, 80 hrs com svc at parks dept, AODA and comply, abs sob, mental health, obt/ mtn ft empt school, domestic abuse alt prog, other counseling, no weapons, letter of apology to victim and no abusive contact with victim. Other counts 36 mo probation and costs
14CF-53: Defendant will plead to Count 1. wihld sentence, 36 mo, costs, DNA surcharge, Domestic Abuse Surcharge, Submit DNA sample if not submitted yet. If revoked, any sentence imposed would be consecutive to any sentence imposed in 13CF-394. 
14CF-54: Defendant will plead to Count 1. 36 mo prob, costs. If revoked, sentence would be consecutive to all other sentences imposed.
14CF-183: Dismissed and Read In.

Atty Drengler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
13CF-394 Count 2: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 13CF-394 Count 3: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 13CF-394 Count 4: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-53 Count 1: NO CONTEST
Defendant enters a plea of: 14CF-54: Count 1: NO CONTEST

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Victim does not wish to make a statement today.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
13CF-394 Count 2: Reckless driving causing bodily harm
13CF-394 Count 3: Battery, Domestic related
13CF-394 Count 4: Disorderly Conduct, Domestic related
13CF-394 Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
14CF-53 Count 1: Felony Bailjumping
14CF-54 Count 1: Felony Bailjumping
14CF-183: Dismissed and Read In

Parties are prepared to go forward without a PSI being ordered.
Court questions Atty Drengler for clarifications.
Defendant wishes to go to sentencing today.

Atty Molepske addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Atty Drengler addresses the Court prior to sentencing, there is 105 days of credit.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

Court believes plea agreement is fair and apporpriate.

BY THE COURT:
13CF-394:
Count 2:
Jail sentence of 1 Year, Imposed and Stayed
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Conditions:
Pay a fine of $500 plus costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge
Jail sentence of 120 Days
105 Jail Days Credit
Perform 80 hours of community service, preferrably at the Portage County Parks Department if applicable
AODA Assesment and comply with treatment recommendations
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Sign all releases 
Use one pharmacy to fill perscriptions
Perform a mental health assessment and comply with recommendations
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time, if agent feels schooling is appropriate
Attend and complete a Domestic Abuse Alternatives Program
Comply with other counseling as recommended by the agent
Do not possess any dangerous weapons during term of probation
Write a letter of apology to the victim
No abusive contact with the victim

Count 3:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Concurrent to Count 2
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 2
Pay costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge

Count 4:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Concurrent to Count 2 and Count 3
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in Count 2 and Count 3
Pay costs
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge

14CF-53:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Concurrent to 13CF-394
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 13CF-394
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay Domestic Abuse Surcharge
Submit to DNA sample if not done so yet
Pay costs

14CF-54:
Sentence is Withheld
Probation for a period of 36 Months
Concurrent to 13CF-394 and 14CF-53
Conditions:
Comply with conditions of probation as stated in 13CF-394 and 14CF-53
Pay costs

All bonds posted are to be applied to fines and costs.
Plea hearing on August 6, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 23, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on March 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
  cases 13CF394,(14CF53,14CF54-prelims today)
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 

  Arraignment:
State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Not Guilty Plea entered.
Bond Continued  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 17, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Ryan L Wojtalewicz in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Bond continued.
14CF54 to follow.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 24, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Don't drive without a valid license. Comply with all bond conditions of 13CF394.

DA case #14PT73
  Court calls case at  1:15 p.m.

DA  states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping (out on bond on 13CF394)
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.

State requests a $500 cash bond:
